vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/c7ef1ece-a170-42e6-80fc-86889073f6e7">USA</keyword>         <topcClas>Energy and fuel - Environment, conservation and land use</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The International Energy Agency (IEA) datasets published by the Energy Statistics Division (ESD) contain annual and quarterly time series data from 1960 onwards on energy production, trade, stocks, transformation, consumption, prices and taxes as well as on greenhouse gas emissions for over the 30 OECD Member countries and over 100 non-OECD countries world-wide.<br> <br> In OECD Member countries the data are collected by official bodies (most often the national statistics office in each country) from firms, government agencies and industry organisations and are then reported to the IEA using questionnaires to ensure international comparability. In non-OECD countries the data are collected directly from government and industry contacts and from national publications.<br> <br> The <i>International Energy Agency (IEA) Energy Technology Research and Development (R and D) Database</i> contains annual time series from 1974 onwards and is divided into two parts:<br> <br> <b>Government Energy Technology R and D Budgets</b><br> Budgets are available for several R and D activities: conservation, fossil fuels, renewable energy, nuclear fission, nuclear fusion as well as power and storage technologies. Data for 23 IEA member countries are available, but no data are provided for Luxembourg which has no energy R and D programmes. Moreover, data for certain countries are not available for all years. Data for the European Commission are currently being revised and have not been included in the database.<br> <br> <b>Economic Indicators (used for deflating and currency conversion)</b><br> Three series are available: Nominal GDP in national currency, US Dollar exchange rate and GDP deflator.<br> <br> These data were first provided by the UK Data Service in June 2005 and are updated annually. The UK Data Service web site includes further information on its <i>IEA Energy Technology R and D</i> holdings, including a <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/iea.aspx" title="IEA Energy Technology Research and Development dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a> and details of <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/iea/et/2011" title="IEA Energy Technology Research and Development Database latest database updates">latest database updates.</a><br> <br> <b>Citation:</b> The bibliographic citation for the database is: International Energy Agency (<i>{YYYY}</i>): Energy Technology Research and Development Database (<i>{Ed. YYYY}</i>). Mimas, University of Manchester. DOI: <i>{edition specific doi - e.g. <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/iea/et/2011">http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/iea/et/2011</a>}</i>. <br> <br> <b>Alternative DOIs:</b> <a href="http://www.oecd-ilibrary.org/energy/data/iea-energy-technology-r-d-statistics_enetech-data-en" title="10.1787/enetech-data-en">10.1787/enetech-data-en</a> (to access via OECD.Stat subscription).<br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Topics covered include various elements of individual countries' energy R and D budgets:<br> <br> <li>energy research and development budgets</li><br> <li>conservation R and D budget</li><br> <li>fossil fuel R and D budget</li><br> <li>renewable energy R and D budget</li><br> <li>nuclear fission R and D budget</li><br> <li>nuclear fusion R and D budget</li><br> <li>power and storage technology R and D budget</li><br> <li>exchange rates</li><br> <li>GDP</li><br> <li>GDP deflator</li><br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd>The <i>IEA Energy Technology R and D Database</i> runs from 1974 onwards and is updated annually.</timePrd>         <nation>Multi-nation</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national; National</universe>         <universe>Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Korea Republic of, Luxembourg, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, United Kingdom, United States.<br>Data for certain countries are not available for all years. In particular, the 'IEA Total Reported' category sum has not been calculated for 1999 due to missing data for several countries. Data for the European Commission are currently being revised and have not been included in the current release.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Aggregate (macro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Time Series</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>annual</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See the <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/iea.aspx" title="IEA dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a> for information on sampling methodology.</sampProc>         <collMode>See the <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/iea.aspx" title="IEA dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a> for further information on methodology.</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>No weighting used</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Restricted access</specPerm>         <restrctn>Registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. Additional special conditions of use also apply. See <a href='http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/how-to-access/conditions/specialconditions.aspx'>terms and conditions</a> for further information.<br/><br/> Available to those registered at UK institutions of higher or further education only.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>
